name: Muslim Legal Fund of America
mission: The Muslim Legal Fund (MLFA) is a community-centric grassroots non-profit organization fighting for national security reform, upholding and establishing justice in our courtrooms and communities for Muslims in America. MLFA is the leading nonprofit legal fund dedicated to defending Muslims’ civil rights and liberties at the federal level. In the guise of national security, MLFA is addressing unwarranted actions towards Muslims, such as travel restrictions, immigration denials, bank account closures, extra scrutiny of nonprofit work, prisoners denied religious accommodations, unjust prosecutions and unfair trials, excessive sentences, and cruel conditions for Muslim prisoners, informants targeting vulnerable youth and Muslims being intimidated into betraying their faith.
theoryOfChange: By litigating federal cases, MLFA aims to set legal precedents ('good law') that protect the entire community and reform national security policies.

rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Legal Fund of America (MLFA) is a specialized legal defense fund that has been <cite id="1">protecting the constitutional rights of individuals</cite> since its <cite id="10">founding in 2001</cite>. The organization addresses systemic injustice by providing legal counsel in criminal, civil, and immigration arenas, specifically focusing on cases where religious or racial identity may lead to disparate treatment. MLFA reported <cite id="3">$3,239,841 in total revenue</cite> for the 2022 tax year, maintaining a <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their work is highly specialized, ranging from <cite id="5">terrorism case acquittals</cite> to <cite id="6">removing individuals from the No Fly List</cite>. Beyond individual litigation, MLFA operates a <cite id="4">Nonprofit Governance Department</cite> to provide technical legal support to Muslim organizations, helping them navigate complex regulatory environments. In 2022 alone, the organization <cite id="4">litigated or processed 101 cases</cite> and reached <cite id="4">505 training attendees</cite> through its educational outreach. As a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, MLFA provides a critical service for Muslim donors looking to support social justice and legal advocacy within the framework of Islamic giving.
